  1# GitHub Actions workflow for Docker CI/CD
  2# This workflow builds, tests, scans, and pushes Docker images
  3
  4name: Docker CI/CD
  5
  6on:
  7  # Trigger on push to main or release branches
  8  push:
  9    branches:
 10      - main
 11      - develop
 12      - 'release/**'
 13    tags:
 14      - 'v*.*.*'
 15
 16  # Trigger on pull requests to main
 17  pull_request:
 18    branches:
 19      - main
 20
 21  # Allow manual trigger
 22  workflow_dispatch:
 23
 24# Cancel in-progress runs for the same branch
 25concurrency:
 26  group: ${{ github.workflow }}-${{ github.ref }}
 27  cancel-in-progress: true
 28
 29env:
 30  # Docker registry configuration
 31  REGISTRY: ghcr.io
 32  IMAGE_NAME: ${{ github.repository }}
 33
 34  # Platforms to build for
 35  PLATFORMS: linux/amd64,linux/arm64
 36
 37jobs:
 38  # ==========================================================================
 39  # Job 1: Build and Test
 40  # ==========================================================================
 41  build-and-test:
 42    name: Build and Test
 43    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
 44    permissions:
 45      contents: read
 46      packages: write
 47      security-events: write
 48
 49    steps:
 50      # ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 51      # Checkout code
 52      # ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 53      - name: Checkout repository
 54        uses: actions/checkout@v4
 55
 56      # ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 57      # Set up Docker Buildx (for multi-platform builds)
 58      # ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 59      - name: Set up Docker Buildx
 60        uses: docker/setup-buildx-action@v3
 61        with:
 62          # Use docker-container driver for better caching
 63          driver-opts: network=host
 64
 65      # ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 66      # Set up QEMU (for cross-platform builds)
 67      # ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 68      - name: Set up QEMU
 69        uses: docker/setup-qemu-action@v3
 70        with:
 71          platforms: arm64
 72
 73      # ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 74      # Extract metadata (tags, labels) for Docker
 75      # ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 76      - name: Extract Docker metadata
 77        id: meta
 78        uses: docker/metadata-action@v5
 79        with:
 80          images: ${{ env.REGISTRY }}/${{ env.IMAGE_NAME }}
 81          tags: |
 82            # Tag with branch name
 83            type=ref,event=branch
 84            # Tag with PR number
 85            type=ref,event=pr
 86            # Tag with semver
 87            type=semver,pattern={{version}}
 88            type=semver,pattern={{major}}.{{minor}}
 89            type=semver,pattern={{major}}
 90            # Tag with commit SHA
 91            type=sha,prefix={{branch}}-
 92            # Tag 'latest' for main branch
 93            type=raw,value=latest,enable={{is_default_branch}}
 94          labels: |
 95            org.opencontainers.image.title=${{ github.repository }}
 96            org.opencontainers.image.description=Flask application
 97            org.opencontainers.image.vendor=${{ github.repository_owner }}
 98
 99      # ----------------------------------------------------------------------
100      # Log in to container registry
101      # ----------------------------------------------------------------------
102      - name: Log in to GitHub Container Registry
103        if: github.event_name != 'pull_request'
104        uses: docker/login-action@v3
105        with:
106          registry: ${{ env.REGISTRY }}
107          username: ${{ github.actor }}
108          password: ${{ secrets.GITHUB_TOKEN }}
109
110      # ----------------------------------------------------------------------
111      # Build Docker image (with cache)
112      # ----------------------------------------------------------------------
113      - name: Build Docker image
114        id: build
115        uses: docker/build-push-action@v5
116        with:
117          context: .
118          platforms: ${{ env.PLATFORMS }}
119          # Only push on main branch or tags
120          push: ${{ github.event_name != 'pull_request' }}
121          tags: ${{ steps.meta.outputs.tags }}
122          labels: ${{ steps.meta.outputs.labels }}
123
124          # Cache configuration for faster builds
125          cache-from: type=gha
126          cache-to: type=gha,mode=max
127
128          # Build arguments
129          build-args: |
130            BUILD_DATE=${{ github.event.head_commit.timestamp }}
131            VCS_REF=${{ github.sha }}
132            VERSION=${{ steps.meta.outputs.version }}
133
134          # Output to local registry for testing (PR only)
135          outputs: ${{ github.event_name == 'pull_request' && 'type=docker,dest=/tmp/image.tar' || '' }}
136
137      # ----------------------------------------------------------------------
138      # Load image for testing (PR only)
139      # ----------------------------------------------------------------------
140      - name: Load image for testing
141        if: github.event_name == 'pull_request'
142        run: |
143          docker load --input /tmp/image.tar
144          docker image ls -a
145
146      # ----------------------------------------------------------------------
147      # Run container tests
148      # ----------------------------------------------------------------------
149      - name: Test Docker image
150        run: |
151          # Get the first tag from metadata
152          IMAGE_TAG=$(echo "${{ steps.meta.outputs.tags }}" | head -n 1)
153
154          # Run container in background
155          docker run -d --name test-container \
156            -p 5000:5000 \
157            -e FLASK_ENV=testing \
158            $IMAGE_TAG
159
160          # Wait for container to start
161          sleep 10
162
163          # Test health endpoint
164          curl -f http://localhost:5000/health || exit 1
165
166          # Test main endpoint
167          curl -f http://localhost:5000/ || exit 1
168
169          # Check logs
170          docker logs test-container
171
172          # Stop and remove container
173          docker stop test-container
174          docker rm test-container
175
176      # ----------------------------------------------------------------------
177      # Security scan with Trivy
178      # ----------------------------------------------------------------------
179      - name: Run Trivy vulnerability scanner
180        uses: aquasecurity/trivy-action@master
181        with:
182          image-ref: ${{ steps.meta.outputs.tags }}
183          format: 'sarif'
184          output: 'trivy-results.sarif'
185          severity: 'CRITICAL,HIGH'
186          exit-code: '1'
187          ignore-unfixed: true
188
189      # ----------------------------------------------------------------------
190      # Upload Trivy results to GitHub Security
191      # ----------------------------------------------------------------------
192      - name: Upload Trivy results to GitHub Security
193        uses: github/codeql-action/upload-sarif@v2
194        if: always()
195        with:
196          sarif_file: 'trivy-results.sarif'
197
198      # ----------------------------------------------------------------------
199      # Generate SBOM (Software Bill of Materials)
200      # ----------------------------------------------------------------------
201      - name: Generate SBOM
202        uses: aquasecurity/trivy-action@master
203        with:
204          image-ref: ${{ steps.meta.outputs.tags }}
205          format: 'cyclonedx'
206          output: 'sbom.json'
207
208      # ----------------------------------------------------------------------
209      # Upload SBOM as artifact
210      # ----------------------------------------------------------------------
211      - name: Upload SBOM
212        uses: actions/upload-artifact@v3
213        with:
214          name: sbom
215          path: sbom.json
216          retention-days: 30
217
218  # ==========================================================================
219  # Job 2: Deploy to Kubernetes (only on main branch)
220  # ==========================================================================
221  deploy:
222    name: Deploy to Kubernetes
223    needs: build-and-test
224    if: github.ref == 'refs/heads/main' && github.event_name == 'push'
225    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
226    environment:
227      name: production
228      url: https://flask-app.example.com
229
230    steps:
231      - name: Checkout repository
232        uses: actions/checkout@v4
233
234      # ----------------------------------------------------------------------
235      # Set up kubectl
236      # ----------------------------------------------------------------------
237      - name: Set up kubectl
238        uses: azure/setup-kubectl@v3
239        with:
240          version: 'latest'
241
242      # ----------------------------------------------------------------------
243      # Configure kubectl with cluster credentials
244      # ----------------------------------------------------------------------
245      - name: Configure kubectl
246        run: |
247          # Decode base64 kubeconfig from secrets
248          echo "${{ secrets.KUBE_CONFIG }}" | base64 -d > kubeconfig.yml
249          export KUBECONFIG=kubeconfig.yml
250
251          # Verify connection
252          kubectl cluster-info
253          kubectl get nodes
254
255      # ----------------------------------------------------------------------
256      # Update Kubernetes deployment
257      # ----------------------------------------------------------------------
258      - name: Update deployment image
259        run: |
260          export KUBECONFIG=kubeconfig.yml
261
262          # Set new image for deployment
263          kubectl set image deployment/flask-app \
264            flask-app=${{ env.REGISTRY }}/${{ env.IMAGE_NAME }}:${{ github.sha }} \
265            --record
266
267          # Wait for rollout to complete
268          kubectl rollout status deployment/flask-app --timeout=5m
269
270      # ----------------------------------------------------------------------
271      # Verify deployment
272      # ----------------------------------------------------------------------
273      - name: Verify deployment
274        run: |
275          export KUBECONFIG=kubeconfig.yml
276
277          # Check pod status
278          kubectl get pods -l app=flask-app
279
280          # Check deployment status
281          kubectl get deployment flask-app
282
283          # Test health endpoint
284          kubectl run curl-test --image=curlimages/curl --rm -it --restart=Never -- \
285            curl -f http://flask-app/health || exit 1
286
287      # ----------------------------------------------------------------------
288      # Cleanup
289      # ----------------------------------------------------------------------
290      - name: Cleanup
291        if: always()
292        run: |
293          rm -f kubeconfig.yml
294
295# ==============================================================================
296# Secrets Required:
297# ==============================================================================
298#
299# GITHUB_TOKEN - Automatically provided by GitHub Actions
300# KUBE_CONFIG - Base64 encoded kubeconfig file for Kubernetes cluster
301#   To create: cat ~/.kube/config | base64 -w 0
302#
303# Optional:
304# DOCKER_USERNAME - Docker Hub username (if using Docker Hub)
305# DOCKER_PASSWORD - Docker Hub password or access token
306# SLACK_WEBHOOK - Slack webhook for notifications
307#
308# ==============================================================================
309# Additional Features to Consider:
310# ==============================================================================
311#
312# 1. Add Slack notifications:
313#    - uses: 8398a7/action-slack@v3
314#
315# 2. Add container signing:
316#    - uses: sigstore/cosign-installer@main
317#
318# 3. Add performance testing:
319#    - Run load tests with k6 or Apache Bench
320#
321# 4. Add smoke tests:
322#    - Test critical user flows after deployment
323#
324# 5. Add rollback on failure:
325#    - kubectl rollout undo deployment/flask-app
326#
327# 6. Add canary deployment:
328#    - Use Flagger or Argo Rollouts
329#
330# 7. Add cost estimation:
331#    - Use Infracost for infrastructure costs
332# ==============================================================================
